properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.configuration
properties.description: Component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.etcd.EtcdConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the etcd-keys component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.password
properties.description: The password to use for basic authentication.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.recursive
properties.description: To apply an action recursively.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.service-path
properties.description: The path to look for for service discovery

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters. The option is a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters type.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.time-to-live
properties.description: To set the lifespan of a key in milliseconds.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.timeout
properties.description: To set the maximum time an action could take to complete. The option is a java.lang.Long type.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.uris
properties.description: To set the URIs the client connects.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.use-global-ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-keys.user-name
properties.description: The user name to use for basic authentication.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.configuration
properties.description: Component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.etcd.EtcdConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the etcd-stats component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.from-index
properties.description: The index to watch from

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.password
properties.description: The password to use for basic authentication.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.recursive
properties.description: To apply an action recursively.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.send-empty-exchange-on-timeout
properties.description: To send an empty message in case of timeout watching for a key.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.service-path
properties.description: The path to look for for service discovery

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters. The option is a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters type.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.time-to-live
properties.description: To set the lifespan of a key in milliseconds.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.timeout
properties.description: To set the maximum time an action could take to complete. The option is a java.lang.Long type.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.uris
properties.description: To set the URIs the client connects.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.use-global-ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.user-name
properties.description: The user name to use for basic authentication.

properties.name: camel.component.etcd-watch.from-index
